intro: Krynitzkia muriculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil. Krynitzkia muriculata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
